items.sentence: Tom plays poker with his friends every Friday night.
Tom is the only boy here who doesn\'t like baseball.
I shouldn\'t have gone home late at night by myself.
We like to drink a cup of coffee after eating lunch.
We need each other more now than we ever did before.
We saw Tom talking to Mary in the park this morning.
Tom didn\'t seem interested in what Mary was saying.
Tom didn\'t seem to be paying much attention to you.
Tom didn\'t seem to even notice that Mary was there.
Tom didn\'t seem to understand what you were saying.
The most beautiful flowers have the sharpest thorns.
Tom first came to Japan when he was three years old.
We should make every effort to maintain world peace.
Why do you have your umbrella up? It\'s not raining.
Why don\'t you just go ahead and pay all your bills?
I\'ve made a lot of friends since I entered college.
If I were a rich man, I wouldn\'t have to work hard.
Why do I have to be the one who makes this decision?
Why is everyone acting like this is such a big deal?
Why is it always my responsibility to pay the bills?
Will you send someone to fix it as soon as possible?
Tom is waiting for Mary in front of the supermarket.
Tom often has trouble choosing what clothes to wear.
Tom woke Mary up at 6:30 as she had asked him to do.
It was courteous of him to write a letter of thanks.
It was raining so hard that we decided to stay home.
Tom bet Mary dinner that it doesn\'t rain this week.
Tom can\'t move this bookcase without a little help.
Tom can\'t read music, so he plays the piano by ear.
Many flights have been canceled because of the snow.
My hands were shaking too much to thread the needle.
Why don\'t you go upstairs and lie down for a while?
Why don\'t you tell Tom what you want for Christmas?
You should make sure that you don\'t make Tom angry.
You\'re supposed to take your shoes off at the door.
Tom informed Mary of his decision to sell the house.
Tom is as hardworking as everyone else in the group.
Tom is drawing a picture of a small boy and his dog.
Don\'t put off until tomorrow what you can do today.
Whoever did it didn\'t want us to find out about it.
Why are you apologizing? You\'ve done nothing wrong.
Tom felt Mary\'s forehead to see if she had a fever.
Tom finally figured out what he\'d been doing wrong.
Tom said he didn\'t know why Mary didn\'t like John.
Last night, I went to bed without brushing my teeth.
I\'ll try not to disturb you while you\'re studying.
I\'m afraid Tom and Mary won\'t get along very well.
Tom always trusts people, even people he shouldn\'t.
Tom told me that I shouldn\'t go out alone at night.
Tom told me that he doesn\'t like carbonated drinks.
